Newall: Teacher under fire was just trying to help a child victimized by the heroin epidemic Updated: January 17, 2017 — 2:34 PM EST 147 Share Mike Newall Inquirer Columnist 
Mike Newall has been writing for the Inquirer since 2010. Originally from Brooklyn, N.Y., he has been writing about Philadelphia crime, courts, politics, and neighborhoods since 2003. Before joining the Inquirer, he was a staff writer and columnist for Philadelphia Weekly and Philadelphia City Paper. He lives in Philadelphia with his wife and dog. More by Mike Newall Arrow icon 
The last time I'd seen Marianne Kennedy she was manning her pantry in the main office of Willard Elementary School in Kensington. Kennedy kept the closet filled with food and clothes for students who needed help beyond the classroom. Every child at Willard — located blocks from the city's worst heroin corners — 
As my colleague Kristen A. Graham reported Monday 
I am glad Kennedy is finally getting her hearing. I hope it's a fair one. Having met her, having visited Willard — having read about the life of the unfortunate kid at the center of this — 
Soon, the hallway was silent, as the hearing began behind doors to decide whether a teacher would ever return to school —
